alert.note: Alert for Coastal Flagler; Coastal St. Johns; Inland Flagler; Inland St. Johns (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 03 at 5:25AM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...Gusty showers will impact portions of northeastern Flagler and southeastern St. Johns Counties through 615 AM EDT... At 523 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking showers and a thunderstorm capable of producing a landspout, heavy rainfall, and gusty winds along a line extending from near Vilano Beach to near Flagler Beach. These showers were nearly stationary or drifting west. HAZARD...Landspouts and winds 30 to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Palm Coast, Saint Augustine, Flagler Beach, Bunnell, Saint Augustine Beach, Marineland, Vilano Beach, Crescent Beach, Saint Augustine Shores and Butler Beach. LANDSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with some of these storms and may lead to localized street flooding along Highway A1A. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Coastal Flagler; Coastal St. Johns; Inland Flagler; Inland St. Johns
